# wangsu_ssl_certificate_application (Resource)

Use this resource to create an SSL certificate application.
This resource allows you to create an SSL certificate application.

## Example Usage

```hcl

resource "wangsu_ssl_certificate_application" "example" {
  algorithm           = "RSA2048"
  auto_deploy         = "true"
  auto_renew          = "false"
  auto_validate       = "true"
  certificate_brand   = "LE"
  certificate_spec    = "LetsEncryptDVFree"
  certificate_type    = "DV"
  description         = "This is description"
  domain_type         = "single"
  org_validate_method = "self_validate"
  validate_method     = "DNS"
  validity_days       = 90
  admin {
    email      = "test1@email.com"
    first_name = "firstName1"
    last_name  = "lastName1"
    phone      = "12345678901"
    title      = "title1"
  }
  dns_provider_infos {
    dns_api_access = jsonencode({
      accessKey = "123456"
      secretKey = "123456"
    })
    dns_provider_code     = "CloudDNS"
    domain                = "www.example.com"
    enable_dns_alias_mode = "true"
    validate_alias_domain = "alias.example.com"
  }
  identification_info {
    city                      = "your city"
    common_name               = "www.example.com"
    company                   = "your company"
    country                   = "CN"
    department                = "cdn"
    email                     = "test@email.com"
    phone                     = "12345678901"
    postal_code               = "123456"
    state                     = "FJ"
    street                    = "software part"
    street1                   = "#18-13"
    subject_alternative_names = ["www.example.com"]
  }
  tech {
    email      = "test2@email.com"
    first_name = "firstName2"
    last_name  = "lastName2"
    phone      = "12345678902"
    title      = "title2"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `algorithm` (String) Certificate Algorithm. Allowed values: RSA2048, ECDSA256.
- `auto_deploy` (String) Whether to deploy automatically. Allowed values: true, false.
- `auto_validate` (String) Automatically validate domain control. Allowed values: true, false.
- `certificate_brand` (String) Certificate Brand. Allowed values: LE, TrustAsia. If LE application fails, will switch to ZeroSSL.
- `certificate_spec` (String) Certificate Specification. See provider documentation for allowed values.
- `certificate_type` (String) Certificate Type. Allowed values: DV, OV. LE only supports DV.
- `identification_info` (Block List, Min: 1, Max: 1) Certificate Signing Request Information. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--identification_info))
- `validate_method` (String) Validate Method. Allowed values: HTTP, DNS. Wildcard domains require DNS.
- `validity_days` (Number) Validity Days for the certificate. See certificateSpec for details.

### Optional

- `admin` (Block List, Max: 1) Order admin contact. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--admin))
- `auto_renew` (String) Automatically renew your certificate. Allowed values: true, false (default).
- `backup_certificate_brand` (String) Backup Certificate Brand. See provider documentation for allowed values.
- `certificate_name` (String) Name of the certificate. The certificate name cannot be the same as your existing certificate. Max 128 characters.
- `description` (String) A description of the new certificate. Max 256 characters.
- `dns_provider_infos` (Block List) DNS Provider Information. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--dns_provider_infos))
- `domain_type` (String) Domain type. Allowed values: single, multi.
- `org_validate_method` (String) Organization validate method. Allowed values: default, self_validate, none.
- `tech` (Block List, Max: 1) Order tech contact. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--tech))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedblock--identification_info"></a>
### Nested Schema for `identification_info`

Required:

- `common_name` (String) A common name of the certificate.
- `subject_alternative_names` (List of String) Hostnames that this certificate will serve.

Optional:

- `city` (String) A city.
- `company` (String) A company name.
- `country` (String) Country. ISO-3166 code, 2 characters.
- `department` (String) The department associated with the certificate.
- `email` (String) Email address.
- `phone` (String) phone.
- `postal_code` (String) postalCode.
- `state` (String) A state or province.
- `street` (String) The street where the company is located.
- `street1` (String) street1.


<a id="nestedblock--admin"></a>
### Nested Schema for `admin`

Optional:

- `email` (String) Email.
- `first_name` (String) First name.
- `last_name` (String) Last name.
- `phone` (String) Phone.
- `title` (String) Title.


<a id="nestedblock--dns_provider_infos"></a>
### Nested Schema for `dns_provider_infos`

Required:

- `domain` (String) Domain.

Optional:

- `dns_api_access` (String) DNS API Access. JSON format, e.g. accessKey/secretKey for CloudDNS.
- `dns_provider_code` (String) DNS Provider Code. Support CloudDNS.
- `enable_dns_alias_mode` (String) Whether to use alias verification. Allowed values: true, false.
- `validate_alias_domain` (String) Validate alias


<a id="nestedblock--tech"></a>
### Nested Schema for `tech`

Optional:

- `email` (String) Email.
- `first_name` (String) First name.
- `last_name` (String) Last name.
- `phone` (String) Phone.
- `title` (String) Title.
